# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is how you can solve this problem using the DataFrames package for Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [year(dt)*100 + month(dt) for dt in df.dt]
end
```
This function operates by iterating over each row of the dataframe and extracting the year and month parts of the date using the `year` and `month` functions from the Dates package. The results are then concatenated into a new column, which is added to the dataframe with the key `:ym`. 

The resultant DataFrame will have an additional column named `ym`, where each element is an integer representing the year and month of the original date. For example, if the original date in row i was "2021-03-15", then the value in the `ym` column would be 202103.
